metadata.title: CVE-2020-24266 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in tcpreplay tcpprep v4.3.3. There is a heap bufferoverflow vulnerability in get_l2len() that can make tcpprep crash and causea denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpreplay - 4.2.6-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tcpreplay package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.6-1ubuntu0.1~esm3').
